alert.note: Alert for Mobile Inland; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 10:21AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Mobile, southwestern Washington, George, southern Perry, southern Greene and Stone Counties through 1115 AM CDT... At 1021 AM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles northwest of Leakesville to near Poplarville. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wiggins, Citronelle, Lucedale, Leakesville, Perkinston, Deer Park, Beaumont, New Augusta and McLain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM CDT for southwestern Alabama...and southeastern Mississippi.
